alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 9:37AM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Beaver Creek near Hinsdale affecting Valley County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. Ice jams have been reported in the area, which could lead to rapid changes in river level. For the Beaver Creek...including Hinsdale...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Beaver Creek near Hinsdale. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, flood stage...river is at or near bankfull at this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 16.1 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage by early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.8 feet on 06/18/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 945 PM MDT.
